name: AG William Tong
tweet: I have heard from a number of community leaders and preservationists who have a strong interest in the future of Deer Lake. I hope that this extended time will allow all sides to work together on a positive resolution.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: I thank the Boy Scouts for hearing my concerns and agreeing to postpone this deadline while our inquiry into the property proceeds, and for being cooperative and responsive to our questions.    https://t.co/MkIdEMDqZv

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Working in coordination with our state and federal partners, our office is prepared to take aggressive action against anyone who abuses our taxpayer-funded healthcare programs.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: AMR-CT billed the state for Advanced Life Support services that local fire departments had already provided. In addition to the significant financial penalty, AMR-CT has entered into a strong consent agreement to ensure this unacceptable overbilling never happens again.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Today with @USAO_CT, I announced a $601,759 settlement with American Medical Response of Connecticut resolving allegations that the ambulance service overbilled the state Medicaid program.    https://t.co/N0mtkMvMRL

name: AG William Tong
tweet: The UConn women are CLUTCH!

name: AG William Tong
tweet: The CT False Claims Act gives us authority to investigate and civilly prosecute abuse of taxpayer funds. But it only applies to health care. That loophole has hamstrung anti-corruption efforts for over a decade.   It’s time for that to change.  https://t.co/qlhRYhxOzh

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Pinewood Derby! Sasha competed in the 2002 District Championship in the Boys Scouts of America Connecticut Yankee Council, Powahay District. Sasha is a proud Webelo, Pack 11, soon to be a Boy Scout.  https://t.co/9MwMtuUxd7

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Happy Greek Independence Day to everyone celebrating in Connecticut. I am proud to live in a state where we celebrate so many cultural traditions and histories.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: This moment is possible because of the dedication and professionalism of Commissioner Dorantes and the entire DCF staff who have committed to the sustained reforms necessary to ensure the protection of Connecticut’s most vulnerable children.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Today’s decision marks the end of three decades of court oversight and is the result of documented and significant improvement at DCF.  https://t.co/Z3X9GSsUxa

name: AG William Tong
tweet: This cruel and dangerous policy forces immigrants to return to Mexico and wait for their cases to be called in U.S. Immigration court. I urge the Supreme Court to overturn this decision and affirm the Biden Admin.’s authority to set immigration policy.   https://t.co/byL183ivwK

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Welcome home to the 550 National Guardsmen and women from the 1-102nd Infantry Battalion. We’re so happy you’re home safe and sound after your deployment!  https://t.co/PbNUTSAdPO

name: AG William Tong
tweet: We cannot waste this opportunity for aggressive federal action to get this hazardous substance out of our homes, apartments, soil, and drinking water and to protect our most vulnerable children.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: The EPA’s proposed strategy is a long-overdue, first step to protecting our children from the serious harms of lead poisoning. But it’s not enough. Every year hundreds of CT children are lead poisoned, with children of color poisoned at much higher rates than their white peers.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: My office will pursue any provider that overcharges Connecticut’s state Medicaid program or misuses resources intended for the care of our state’s most vulnerable residents.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Today I announced a $1 million settlement with a Wallingford pain medicine practice to resolve allegations that they overbilled the Connecticut Medicaid program.    https://t.co/KsRpvUeg98

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Happy St. Patrick's Day to all who are celebrating today!  https://t.co/Doyk90Htto

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Tong Tasting North Stonington edition! After presenting the Citizen Hero Award last week, I had to stay at Red Onion Pizza for a fresh slice with Mr. Guy. Although, Mr. Guy’s favorite is a sausage grinder. I’d have to agree, I’m going back so he and I can each have that grinder.  https://t.co/C5aXfpGyze

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Consumers need to research these products thoroughly before spending their money on a product that may or may not provide hearing assistance. Our investigation is ongoing and any company marketing these hearing devices as FDA approved should expect to hear from our investigators.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Over-the-counter hearing aids may be fine options for certain adults with mild to moderate hearing loss, but there is no federal approval of these products right now.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Today I announced four separate settlements with over-the-counter hearing aid companies who marketed their products as “FDA-approved” when they were not.    https://t.co/Wc9YEcg5zX

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Tong Tasting U.S. Coast Guard edition! On my visit to the Coast Guard Station in New Haven this week with @MayorElicker, I had the three course special — chicken and macaroni soup, salad and flank steak with asparagus. Compliments to the great cooks in the galley!  https://t.co/yfiXCuOB2j

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Elder justice issues can be anything from age-based discrimination in the workplace to abuse by a caregiver. If you or anyone you know has been the victim of a scam or fraud or has been exploited or neglected, we want to help. Just call 1-860-808-5555.   https://t.co/7lQeGCQoHN

name: AG William Tong
tweet: The Sacklers were forced to listen to victims today, but I hope they truly heard the pain and anguish in the voices of the people who have lost loved ones. The survivors who spoke today showed bravery and courage in the face of incredible suffering.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: If you have been the victim of a scam, or have been neglected, exploited or abused, we are all here to help. Just call 1-860-808-5555.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Thank you @21KevinKelly, @PhilYoungCT,  @RepRutigliano, @trumbullpolice, @ElderJusticeCT, @CTLTCOP and Reps. Joe Gresko & Laura Devlin for joining me in Stratford and Trumbull to discuss the Elder Justice Hotline and the work all of us do to keep older adults safe and cared for.  https://t.co/NZ6k7pRw6N

name: AG William Tong
tweet: These regulations are critical to combating climate change and protecting public health and must remain intact.   https://t.co/YiDSBAmxG7

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Greenhouse gas emissions from vehicles are one of the largest drivers of climate change and a serious threat to our health. We urged the EPA to adopt stringent  regulations, and now we are defending those necessary and lawful standards from a series of baseless partisan attacks.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: My office has gotten many complaints about gas prices. Not every price increase is price gouging, but we will investigate every report we receive during this abnormal market disruption. If you see high prices and want to file a complaint to our office, here are some tips:  https://t.co/TI329UKGvT

name: AG William Tong
tweet: We are not done fighting for justice against the addiction industry.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: I thank the Bankruptcy Court for its approval, and for its support for the hearing tomorrow that will give victims and survivors the opportunity to speak directly to the Sacklers and share the damage and destruction they have caused.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: No settlement will ever come close to addressing the magnitude of suffering and harm caused by Purdue and the Sackler family. But in reaching this $6 billion settlement we recognized that we could not stall this process forever for victims and our sister states.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: This is a huge victory for air quality and our climate. I applaud the Biden Admin. for restoring California’s waiver for clean car standards. These standards, adopted by Connecticut under the Clean Air Act, are critical to fight climate change and improve public health.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Thank you to Captain Eva Van Camp and her team for showing me and @MayorElicker around the U.S. Coast Guard Station in New Haven. They are incredibly busy protecting our waterways and keeping boaters safe. Thank you to all the guardsmen and women of Sector Long Island Sound!  https://t.co/Gre2wjbLbB

name: AG William Tong
tweet: If you are in need of assistance and don’t know who to call or where to find it, call my office at 860-808-5000 or email attorney.general@ct.gov.   You can also call our Elder Justice Hotline at 860-808-5555 for questions specific to issues affecting older adults.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Cheryl, Bob and Jason’s kindness and willingness to go above and beyond to help Mr. Guy personify the spirit of this award.  https://t.co/ffb9CePIVi

name: AG William Tong
tweet: On Tuesday, it was my great pleasure to honor Cheryl, First Selectman Bob Carlson and Trooper Jason McCarthy with my office’s first Citizen Hero Award. This award is given to an individual or individuals whose extraordinary actions keep their neighbors safe, healthy and secure.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Thanks to the generosity of the community, the group was able to get Mr. Guy a room at a local inn while Cheryl worked to secure permanent housing. Just this week, they learned that Mr. Guy had secured permanent living accommodations at the Veterans Base Camp in Chaplin.

name: AG William Tong
tweet: Cheryl knew she had to get Mr. Guy help and connected with North Stonington First Selectman Bob Carlson and @CT_STATE_POLICE Trooper Jason McCarthy for assistance. Together, they reached out to many people, including my office, for help.
